discussion.content:
The Answer is hashing and salting. Why?
Hashing protect if two users accidentally created similar

comments.content: If two users accidentally create two identical password then salting password will protect it from being mixed one another. Similarly hashing the password is also ptoyecty the password to not be visible in clerar text meaning it will be changed into something else that no one can see and interpret the pwd meaning hashing is a one way journey no one can decrypt the password once it has been hashed

discussion.content:
gh ;j SKSTOi;618& this does not seem to be encrypted or hashed due to length (clear text). Unless this is a weak cipher. Passwords should be hashed, salted, & stretching.
What is the correct technical control? Technical controls, Controls that rely on technology.
Just remember this on test 2-days ago. Ans: AD also makes common sense.
Its is not need to read the question. it is "have been implemented". The provided answer is correct
AD correct. Where else do you see hashed pass? In any case pass hash or salted hash wouldn't look like that :)

comments.content: A and D ar correct, because lenght are 17 symbols and it is quite complex, so weak encryption, or no salting is used. Complexity is a password control. In windows env. you do Group policies where you technically control password lenght, complexitivity etc.

questions.question_text:
After running an online password cracking tool, an attacker recovers the following password: gh ;j SKSTOi;618&
Based on the above information, which of the following technical controls have been implemented? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: If u see command that contains if in SY0-501, it is logic bomb

This is a tricky one if you follow it all the way out. If it happened once then its clearly a logic bomb... but this is happening every Thursday. Its deleted the C: drive. Which means the systems have been recovered and set back up... and it happens again... That's a Rootkit. So if its both things, which one is it more of? LB because of the time? or rootkit cause it keeps coming back? I'd probably go C just cause that was my first thought. But every Thursday sticks with me

comments.content: if statement = logic bomb, just remember that for the different variants of this question.

questions.question_text:
A company notices that at 10 a.m. every Thursday, three users' computers become inoperable. The security analyst team discovers a file called where.pdf.exe that runs on system startup. The contents of where.pdf.exe are shown below:
@echo off
if [c:\file.txt] deltree C:\
Based on the above information, which of the following types of malware was discovered?

discussion.content: See Risk score, the highest the first.

comments.content: check the highest on the risk column

questions.question_text: A security administrator wants to better prepare the incident response team for possible security events. The IRP has been updated and distributed to incident response team members. Which of the following is the BEST option to fulfill the administrator's objective?

discussion.content: i and brian say this is bs

choices.A: Identify the member's roles and responsibilities

questions.question_text: A company hired a firm to test the security posture of its database servers and determine if any vulnerabilities can be exploited. The company provided limited information pertaining to the infrastructure and database server. Which of the following forms of testing does this BEST describe?

discussion.content: This question was on the test. Jan, 24, 2020.
Gray. It would have been white, if he was hired with full info and transparency. However, only limited info was available.
